abilities.name: Item Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Pokémon Tool card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Slowking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Aftermath
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon Tool card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

data.name: Hoothoot

abilities.name: Insomnia
abilities.text: Hoothoot can't be Asleep.

data.flavorText: It has a perfect sense of time. Whatever happens, it keeps rhythm by precisely tilting its head in time.

data.name: Gyarados-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam-GX
attacks.text: (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

data.name: Lugia

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is said to be the guardian of the seas. It is rumored to have been seen on the night of a storm.

data.name: Heracross

abilities.name: Final Blow
abilities.text: If Heracross's remaining HP are 20 or less, you may make its Megahorn attack's base damage 120 instead of 60. This power can't be used if Heracross is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Megahorn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This powerful Pokémon thrusts its prized horn under its enemies' bellies, then lifts and throws them.

data.name: Team Aqua's Walrein

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Blizzard
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It's good at attacks that freeze opponents with a powerful cold snap. Then, it pulverizes a frozen foe with its sharp tusks!

abilities.name: Heavyweight
abilities.text: As long as there is a Grass Energy attached to Muk, you must pay an additional ColorlessColorless to retreat it.

attacks.name: Burning Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Grass Energy attached to Muk. If any of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and Burned.

data.name: Dewpider

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: It crawls onto the land in search of food. Its water bubble allows it to breathe and protects its soft head.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

data.name: Delphox BREAK
rules: BREAK Evolution Rule: Delphox BREAK retains the attacks, Abilities, Weakness, Resistance, and Retreat Cost of its previous Evolution.

abilities.name: Flare Witch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Psy Shadow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Gardevoir is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to Gardevoir and the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Bronzong

attacks.name: Oracle Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Antigravity
attacks.text: The Retreat Cost for Bronzong is 0 until the end of your next turn.

data.flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

abilities.name: Dual Aura
abilities.text: As long as you have Latias or Latias ex in play, each player's Evolved Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Bodies.

attacks.name: Aqua Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy attached to Latios.

data.name: Accelgor

attacks.name: Deck and Cover
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

data.flavorText: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Kyogre but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Improvisational Performance
attacks.text: If you have exactly 1 card in your hand, this attack does 100 more damage. If you have exactly 3 cards in your hand, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If you have exactly 6 cards in your hand, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

data.name: Chatot

attacks.name: Me First
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Tone-Deaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

data.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

data.name: Masquerain

attacks.name: Spiral Gyration
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It flaps its four wings to hover and fly freely in any direction–to and fro and sideways.

data.name: Cacturne

attacks.name: Spike Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Hunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It becomes active at night, seeking prey that is exhausted from the day's desert heat.

abilities.name: Psylink
abilities.text: Sabrina's Alakazam always has a copy of every attack your Psychic Pokémon in play have (including their Energy costs and anything else required in order to use those attacks, such as discarding Energy cards). This power can't be used if Sabrina's Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Burn
attacks.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

data.name: Grovyle

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in dense jungles. While closing in on its prey, it leaps from branch to branch.

data.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Returning Flames
attacks.text: Put 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.

data.flavorText: Its legs grow strong while it chases after its parent. It runs in fields and mountains all day.

attacks.name: Psychic Removal
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grudge
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Tepig

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

data.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Prehistoric Power
abilities.text: No more Evolution cards can be played. This power stops working while Aerodactyl is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: A ferocious prehistoric Pokémon that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs.

data.name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Saliva Lure
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stick and Absorb
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from Carnivine. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It walks around on its tentacles in search of a tree branch where it can dangle down and ambush prey.

data.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Serene Grace
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Togekiss from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may look at the top 10 cards of your deck, choose as many basic Energy cards as you like, and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Put the other cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Air Scroll
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, remove 3 damage counters from Togekiss.

data.flavorText: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.

data.name: Fletchinder

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

data.name: Nuzleaf
data.flavorText: It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head, it makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Magnetic Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Lightning or Metal Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Speed Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crush Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to Magnezone.

data.name: Vivillon

attacks.name: Vivid Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

data.flavorText: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

data.name: Giratina

attacks.name: Shadow Force
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Giratina during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Brutal Edge
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

data.name: Serperior

attacks.name: Double Slash
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

data.name: Ralts

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It uses the horns on its head to sense human emotions. It is said to appear in front of cheerful people.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon has already has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Call of the Night
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

data.name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Darkness Fan
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Evolved Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from that Pokémon, and put it back into his or her hand. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spirit Dance
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

data.name: Vulpix

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: Its beautiful tails have made it very popular. However, if it's not brushed diligently, it will be a mass of tangles before you know it.

data.name: Thwackey

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

abilities.name: Flame Vapor
abilities.text: When you play Gyarados from your hand to evolve your Active Pokémon, you may flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon's Vengeance
attacks.text: If Gyarados has 7 or more damage counters on it, this attack's base damage is 100.

data.name: Skiddo

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

attacks.name: Mystic Fang
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Salandit

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

data.name: Maractus

attacks.name: Constant Rattle
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 60 damage.

attacks.name: Giga Drain
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: It likes swimming around with people on its back. In the Alola region, it's an important means of transportation over water.

data.name: Kabutops

attacks.name: Hydrocutter
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy cards attached to Kabutops. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

data.flavorText: In the water, it tucks its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.

data.name: Entei

ancientTrait.name: θ Double
ancientTrait.text: This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Flame Screen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

data.name: Meowth VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Gold Rush
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Vengeful Spikes
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, and Kabutops ex in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Foongus

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

data.flavorText: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.

data.name: Salamence

attacks.name: Direct Hit
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragon Finish
attacks.text: Discard 2 basic Fire Energy cards or 2 basic Water Energy cards attached to Salamence. If you discarded 2 basic Fire Energy cards, this attack does 100 damage to the Defending Pokémon. If you discarded 2 Basic Water Energy cards, this attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (If you can't discard cards, this attack does nothing.)

data.flavorText: As a result of its long-held dream of flying, its cellular structure changes, and wings grew out.

data.name: Primeape

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape. Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: This Pokémon only calms down when there are no other animals or people around—which means no one has ever seen it when it's not angry.

data.name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Shifty Substitution
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, each Supporter card in your opponent's hand has the effect "Draw 3 cards." (This happens instead of the card's usual effect.)

attacks.name: Fan Tornado
attacks.text: You may have your opponent switch their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian. It can read the foe's mind and take preemptive action.

data.name: Totodile

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

data.name: Jumpluff

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Jumpluff, if it has any.

data.flavorText: Once it catches the wind, it deftly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.

data.name: Sceptile

abilities.name: Power of Nature
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Pokémon that have any Grass Energy attached to them by attacks from your opponent's Ultra Beasts.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

data.name: Mr. Briney's Compassion
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play (excluding Pokémon-ex). Return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

data.name: Sentret

attacks.name: Grope
attacks.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card on the bottom of your deck.

data.flavorText: It has a very nervous nature. It stands up high on its tail so it can scan wide areas.

data.name: Litten

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Lombre

abilities.name: Top Entry
abilities.text: Once during your turn, if you drew this Pokémon from your deck at the beginning of your turn and your Bench isn't full, before you put it into your hand, you may put it onto your Bench.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall. It feeds on aquatic mosses that grow in the riverbed.

data.name: Oshawott

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

data.name: Sewaddle

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: This Pokémon makes clothes for itself. It chews up leaves and sews them with sticky thread extruded from its mouth.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, base damage of Swellow's Agility is 70 instead of 30.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swellow during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

data.name: Charmeleon

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

abilities.name: Moonlight
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put a card from your hand back on your deck. If you do, search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Clefable is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 times the number of heads.

data.name: Umbreon δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Darkness Metal type.

abilities.name: Delta Moon
abilities.text: When your opponent attaches a Special Energy card from his or her hand to 1 of his or her Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Delta Moon Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Rapidash

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It gallops at nearly 150 mph. With its mane blazing ferociously, it races as if it were an arrow.

data.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Chimchar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads discard a Fire Energy attached to Chimchar.

data.flavorText: It agilely scales cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

data.name: Skiploom

abilities.name: Floral Path to the Sky
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for Jumpluff, put this Pokémon and all cards attached to it in the Lost Zone, and put that Jumpluff in its place. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It spreads its petals to absorb sunlight. It also floats in the air to get closer to the sun.

data.name: Blaine
rules: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)

data.name: Gliscor

attacks.name: Burning Poison
attacks.text: Choose either Burned or Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition. You may return Gliscor and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

data.name: Charmeleon

abilities.name: Burning Fighter
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are Fire Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the air temperature to unbearably high levels.

abilities.name: Overzealous
abilities.text: If your opponent has any Pokémon-ex in play, each of Machamp's attacks do 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Brick Smash
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cross Chop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Braixen

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

abilities.name: Sharing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this power. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's hand.) You can't use more than 1 Sharing Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Milotic is affected by a Special Condition.

data.name: Dodrio

abilities.name: Retreat Aid
abilities.text: As long as Dodrio is on your Bench, your Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless less.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It collects data and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and fall into a state of immobility.

data.name: Rillaboom

abilities.name: Voltage Beat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

data.name: Skuntank

attacks.name: Frustration
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that doesn't have any damage counters on it. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Toxic Cloud
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

data.flavorText: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

data.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Aqua Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Chesnaught

abilities.name: Spiky Shield
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Touchdown
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Roserade

abilities.name: Le Parfum
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Squeeze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Each of its hands contains different toxins, but both hands can jab with near-fatal power.

data.name: Tropius

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.flavorText: The bunch of fruit around its neck ripens twice a year and is delicious. It's a highly favored tropical snack.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: Their coloring changes according to the season and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.

data.name: Karrablast

abilities.name: Shell On
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a Shelmet from your hand. If you do, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon to evolve it. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

data.name: Paras

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 basic Pokémon SP and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon SP you have in play.

abilities.name: Extreme Speed
abilities.text: Arcanine G's Retreat Cost is Colorless less for each Fire Energy attached to Arcanine G.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Cure Powder
attacks.text: Remove 3 damage counters from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Water-repellent powder on its wings enables it to collect honey, even in the heaviest of rains.

data.name: Altaria

attacks.name: Dragonbreath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Cotton Cloud
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Altaria by attacks from your opponent's Evolved Pokémon is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It looks like a fluffy cloud when it is in flight. It hums with its soprano voice.

data.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Fasten Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

data.name: Karrablast

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.

data.name: Druddigon

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Dragon Tail
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

data.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Able to understand human speech and very intelligent, it loves to swim in the sea with people on its back.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

abilities.name: Empty Shell
abilities.text: When Shedinja is Knocked Out, your opponent doesn't take any Prize cards.

attacks.name: Extra Curse
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, put 4 damage counters instead.

data.name: Gible

attacks.name: Push Down
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Its nests is small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: Covered with light blue fur, its hide is thick and tough. It is active in bitter cold of -40 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Crustle

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 more damage.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

data.name: Beedrill

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Swarming Sting
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage times the number of Beedrill you have in play to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

data.name: Yveltal

attacks.name: Oblivion Wing
attacks.text: Attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Darkness Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

data.flavorText: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of all living creatures.

abilities.name: Reactive Booster
abilities.text: Each React Energy card attached to all of your Huntail and Gorebyss provides 2 Energy of every type but has no effect other than providing Energy.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Gorebyss but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

data.name: Pansear
data.flavorText: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

data.name: Crobat

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Hurricane Wing
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: The development of wings on its legs enables it to fly fast but also makes it tough to stop and rest.

abilities.name: Crush Chance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Tauros from your hand onto your Bench, you may discard a Stadium card in play.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Vileplume

abilities.name: Varied Pollen
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, choose Asleep, Burned, Confused, or Poisoned. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Bloom
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

data.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: Screech
attacks.text: During your next turn, any damage done to the Defending Pokémon by attacks is increased by 60 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

data.name: Venusaur

abilities.name: Energy Trans
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may take 1 Grass Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to a different one. This power can't be used if Venusaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.

data.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Raichu.

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raichu does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

data.name: Magnezone

abilities.name: Super Connectivity
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a Lightning or Metal Energy card and attach it to your Active Pokémon. Then, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. This power can't be used if Magnezone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Gyro Ball
attacks.text: You may switch Magnezone with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Copy
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Copy copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Sudowoodo doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Sudowoodo performs that attack.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 50 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Sudowoodo.

data.name: Shroomish

attacks.name: Spore
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: It spouts poison spores from the top of its head. These spores cause pain all over if inhaled.

data.name: Ninetales

abilities.name: Nine Temptations
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard 2 Fire Energy cards from your hand. If you do, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is vindictive and relentless by nature. Those who cross it even once will be cursed for a thousand years, along with their descendants.

data.name: Litwick

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

data.name: Cherrim

abilities.name: Cloudy Sky
abilities.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon or Fire Pokémon would be damaged by an attack, reduce that damage by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Worry Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

data.name: Raikou

abilities.name: Lightning Burst
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Raikou, if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. This power stops working while Raikou is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Tackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Raikou does 20 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

data.name: Gardevoir V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swelling Pulse
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was healed during this turn, this attack does 80 more damage.

abilities.name: Dark Trance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Darkness Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Dark Dragonite is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Lonely Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage plus 20 damage times the number of your opponent's Benched Pokémon minus the number of your Benched Pokémon. (For example, if your opponent has 3 Benched Pokémon and you have 1, this attack will do 30 damage plus 40 more damage.)

data.name: Kabutops

abilities.name: Primal Shell
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

abilities.name: Duplicate
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for another Ditto and switch it with Ditto. (Any cards attached to Ditto, damage counters, Special Conditions, and effects on it are now on the new Pokémon.) If you do, put Ditto on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward. You can't use more than 1 Duplicate Poké-Power each turn.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Noctowl

abilities.name: Night Scope
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Noctowl is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

abilities.name: Spiral
abilities.text: As long as Poliwrath is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Confused Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Split Spiral Punch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Flareon

attacks.name: Sand-Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fire Slash
attacks.text: You may discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: Inhaled air is heated in the flame sac in its body to an intense fire over 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

abilities.name: Earth Rage
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Nidoking is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Nidoking is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Giant Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.name: Fomantis

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

data.name: Machamp

abilities.name: Strikes Back
abilities.text: Whenever your opponent's attack damages Machamp (even if Machamp is Knocked Out), this power does 10 damage to the attacking Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.) This power can't be used if Machamp is already affected by a Special Condition when your opponent attacks.

data.flavorText: Using its amazing muscles, it throws powerful punches that can knock its victim clear over the horizon.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Healing Wave
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Ditto

abilities.name: Dittobolic
abilities.text: The number of Benched Pokémon your opponent can have is now 4. If your opponent has 5 Benched Pokémon, your opponent must discard 1 of them and all cards attached to it.

data.flavorText: Its transformation ability is perfect. However, if made to laugh, it can't maintain its disguise.

attacks.name: Scam
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may have your opponent shuffle a Supporter card you find there into his or her deck. If you do, your opponent draws a card.

attacks.name: Metal Hook
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Continuous Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.flavorText: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!

data.name: Rillaboom

attacks.name: Drum Roll
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Drum Beating
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Drum Beating.

data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

abilities.name: Sand Guard
abilities.text: Whenever Flygon would be damaged by your opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 20.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Flygon.

data.name: Tangela

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Blue plant vines cloak the Pokémon's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.

data.name: Ludicolo

attacks.name: Spirited Rushdown
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each Prize card you have taken.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The rhythm of bright, festive music activates Ludicolo's cells, making it more powerful.

data.name: Heatran

abilities.name: Flash Fire
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Fire Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Heatran. This power can't be used if Heatran is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magma Storm
attacks.text: You may discard as many basic Energy cards as you like attached to Heatran. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Energy card you discarded.

data.flavorText: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

data.name: Drifblim

attacks.name: Balloon Tackle
attacks.text: Drifblim does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Take Away
attacks.text: Shuffle Drifblim and all cards attached to it back into your deck. Then, your opponent shuffles the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck. (You choose your new Active Pokémon first.)

data.flavorText: It can generate and release gas within its body. That's how it can control the altitude of its drift.

data.name: Parasect

attacks.name: Colorful Spores
attacks.text: Choose 3 of your Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a different type of basic Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: The larger the mushroom on its back grows, the stronger the mushroom spores it scatters.

data.name: Gengar

abilities.name: Curse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon to another of your opponent's Pokémon. This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Shadow Skip
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) You may switch Gengar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The leer that floats in darkness belongs to a Gengar delighting in casting curses on people.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

data.name: Chesnaught

attacks.name: Spike Lariat
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

attacks.name: Adamantine Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

data.name: Simisage

attacks.name: Leaf Supply
attacks.text: You may attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It attacks enemies with strikes of its thorn-covered tail. This Pokémon is wild tempered.

data.name: Ditto

attacks.name: Copy Anything
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack. If this Pokémon doesn't have the necessary Energy to use that attack, this attack does nothing.

data.flavorText: While it can transform into anything, each Ditto apparently has its own strengths and weaknesses when it comes to transformations.

data.name: Shroomish
data.flavorText: It prefers damp places. By day it remains still in the forest shade. It releases toxic powder from its head.

data.name: Remoraid

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Wide Laser
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Mewtwo

attacks.name: Energy Control
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a basic Energy card attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and attach it to another of your opponent's Pokémon of your choice.

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

data.flavorText: A scientist created this Pokémon after years of horrific gene-splicing and DNA engineering experiments.

data.name: Litleo
data.flavorText: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

data.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Stadium Burn
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.flavorText: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

data.name: Scatterbug
data.flavorText: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

data.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

data.name: Shelmet

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: When it and Karrablast are together, and both receive electrical stimulation, they both evolve.

data.name: Gogoat

attacks.name: Milk Drink
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

data.name: Leavanny

attacks.name: Triple Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

data.name: Dark Vileplume

abilities.name: Hay Fever
abilities.text: No Trainer cards can be played. This power stops working while Dark Vileplume is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Petal Whirlwind
attacks.text: Flip a coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. If you get 2 or more heads, Dark Vileplume is now Confused (after doing damage).

data.flavorText: Perhaps because of their strong-smelling pollen, other Pokémon do not approach areas where Vileplumes live.

data.name: Amoonguss

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

data.flavorText: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

data.name: Dewgong

attacks.name: Freezing Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.

data.name: Pidgeot δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Lightning Metal type.

abilities.name: Delta Reserve
abilities.text: As long as Pidgeot has any Holon Energy cards attached to it, each player's Pokémon (excluding Pokémon that has δ on its card) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Pidgeot. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Pidgeot.

data.name: Magmortar

attacks.name: Hard Crush
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards from your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Energy cards you discarded.

attacks.name: Mantle Bazooka
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Magmortar.

data.flavorText: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

data.name: Rillaboom

abilities.name: Voltage Beat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

data.name: Armaldo ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Twin-blade
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supersonic Claws
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

data.name: Araquanid

abilities.name: Water Bubble
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Fire Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It delivers headbutts with the water bubble on its head. Small Pokémon get sucked into the bubble, where they drown.

data.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Aqua Recover
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Suicune from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 Water Pokémon, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Cure Stream
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: It races around the world to purify fouled water. It dashes away with the north wind.

data.name: Spinda

attacks.name: Dish Out
attacks.text: Draw a card from the top and the bottom of your deck.

attacks.name: Synchro Punch
attacks.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Spinda is the same type as any Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: No two SPINDA have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

data.name: Brock
rules: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Crash Chant
attacks.text: Choose up to 4 in any combination of Pokémon Tool cards and Technical Machine cards in play (both yours and your opponent's) and discard them. This attack does 20 damage times the number of cards discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Horror Chant
attacks.text: If your opponent has 4 or more Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Numb
attacks.text: If Pikachu evolved from Pichu during this turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.

data.name: Feraligatr

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Breaking Tail
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking and discard it.

data.flavorText: It usually moves slowly, but it goes at blinding speed when it attacks and bites prey.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Eevee does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Swadloon

abilities.name: Swaddling Leaves
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

attacks.name: Miracle Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition (Asleep, Burned, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned). The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

attacks.name: Roasting Heat
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Burned, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Dragonite

attacks.name: Calming Wind
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions from Dragonite.

attacks.name: Dragon Stamp
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: This marine Pokémon has an impressive build that lets it freely fly over raging seas without trouble.

data.name: Leafeon

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Leafeon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

data.name: Kingdra

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Kingdra.

attacks.name: Dragon Tornado
attacks.text: If this attack doesn't Knock Out the Defending Pokémon, and if there are any Pokémon on your opponent's Bench, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

attacks.name: Bursting Inferno
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Vaporeon δ
rules: This Pokémon is both Water Metal type.

attacks.name: Delta Search
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Holon Energy card and attach it to Vaporeon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Return Wave
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Vaporeon to your hand. If you do, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

data.name: Jumpluff

attacks.name: Lost March
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each of your Pokémon, except ◇ (Prism Star) Pokémon, in the Lost Zone.

data.flavorText: Even in the fiercest wind, it can control its fluff to make its way to any place in the world it wants.

data.name: Carnivine

attacks.name: Flick Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

data.name: Lurantis-GX
rules: Pokémon-GX rule: When your Pokémon-GX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Flower Supply
attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Solar Blade
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chloroscythe-GX
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage times the amount of Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Green Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

data.flavorText: It raises its tail to check its surroundings. The tail is sometimes struck by lightning in this pose.

data.name: Team Aqua's Grimer
data.flavorText: Its flexible body, which allows it to squeeze into any cracks, comes in handy when invading enemy hideouts.

data.name: Venonat

attacks.name: Radar Eyes
attacks.text: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.

data.flavorText: Its big eyes are actually clusters of tiny eyes. At night, its kind is drawn by light.

data.name: Salandit

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: It burns its bodily fluids to create a poisonous gas. When its enemies become disoriented from inhaling the gas, it attacks them.

data.name: Whimsicott

attacks.name: Fluffy Tag
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. During your next turn, the attacks of that Pokémon do 40 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Stun Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.flavorText: They appear along with whirlwinds. They pull pranks, such as moving furniture and leaving balls of cotton in homes.

data.name: Pikachu

abilities.name: Electro Recycle
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Pichu is anywhere under Pikachu, you may search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. This power can't be used if Pikachu is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: BikaBika
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: It lives in forests with others. It stores electricity in the pouches on its cheeks.

data.name: Multi Technical Machine 01
rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. At the end of your turn, discard Multi Technical Machine 01.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Petilil

attacks.name: Aromatherapy
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

data.name: Sceptile

abilities.name: Power of Nature
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to your Pokémon that have any Grass Energy attached to them by attacks from your opponent's Ultra Beasts.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

data.name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, return the Defending Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your opponent's hand.

data.flavorText: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp.

data.name: Night Maintenance
rules: Search your discard pile for up to 3 in any combination of Pokémon and basic Energy cards. Show them to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

data.name: Kingler

attacks.name: Guard Claw
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.flavorText: The large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

data.name: Magnemite

attacks.name: Lock-on
attacks.text: During your next turn, treat any tails flipped when using Magnemite's Electric Bolt attack as if they were heads. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Electric Bolt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

data.flavorText: These Pokémon are attracted to electrical emissions and will often follow people using PokéGear.

data.name: Ponyta

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.flavorText: As a newborn, it can barely stand. However, through galloping, its legs are made tougher and faster.

abilities.name: Shell Retreat
abilities.text: As long as Squirtle has any Energy cards attached to it, damage done to Squirtle by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Salazzle

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. It can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

data.name: Staraptor

attacks.name: Accelerative Dive
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, prevent all damage done to Staraptor by attacks (both yours and your opponent's) until the end of your next turn.

attacks.name: Brave Heart
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Staraptor does 100 damage to itself.

data.flavorText: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.

attacks.name: Super Slap Push
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Mega Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Midnight Eyes
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Perish Song
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep and was damaged or affected by Midnight Eyes during your last turn, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Healing Song
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Alolan Vulpix

attacks.name: Beacon
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.flavorText: It exhales air colder than -58 degrees Fahrenheit. Elderly people in Alola call this Pokémon by an older name—Keokeo.

data.name: Fearow

attacks.name: Repeating Drill
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: It shoots itself suddenly high into the sky, then plummets down in one fell swoop to strike its prey.

data.name: Giovanni
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play with Giovanni in its name. For the rest of your turn, you may evolve that Pokémon even if you just played or evolved it this turn or if this is your first turn. This effect also applies to the Pokémon it evolves into.

data.name: Chimchar

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

data.name: Scyther

attacks.name: Swords Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, Scyther's Slash attack's base damage is 60 instead of 30.

data.flavorText: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one of it.

data.name: Delphox

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

data.name: Muk

abilities.name: Toxic Gas
abilities.text: Ignore all Pokémon Powers other than Toxic Gases. This power stops working while Muk is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Sludge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.flavorText: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison.

data.name: Vaporeon

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: Clean, clear waters are its usual habitat. When it's about to be attacked by an invading enemy, it dives into the water to hide.

data.name: Karrablast

attacks.name: Mysterious Evolution
attacks.text: If Shelmet is in play, search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: When they feel threatened, they spit acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Horn
attacks.text: You may discard a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Suicune

abilities.name: Crystal Body
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, other than damage, done to Suicune. This power stops working while Suicune is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Aurora Wave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If only 1 is heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Said to be the reincarnation of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Chakra Points
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

abilities.name: Reactive Generator
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Huntail has no React Energy cards attached to it, you may search your deck for a React Energy card and attach it to Huntail. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Huntail is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Self-healing
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Lightning Energy card from your hand to Jolteon, remove all Special Conditions affecting Jolteon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Thunderspark
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon with at least 1 Energy card attached to it (yours and your opponent's).

data.name: Gardevoir VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Cure
attacks.text: Heal 50 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Zapdos does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Zapdos in order to use this attack.

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon said to appear from clouds while wielding enormous lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Poison Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Long Whip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by any Special Conditions, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Dark Muk
rules: This Pokémon is both Grass Darkness type.

abilities.name: Sticky Goo
abilities.text: As long as Dark Muk is your Active Pokémon, your opponent pays ColorlessColorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Slimy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

attacks.name: Acidic Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

data.name: Togedemaru

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.flavorText: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

abilities.name: Fluffy Fur
abilities.text: If Wigglytuff is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Wigglytuff is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Deerling

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.flavorText: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

abilities.name: Rain Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy from your hand to 1 of your Water Pokémon. This power can't be used if Feraligatr is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hydro Crunch
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

data.name: Maractus

attacks.name: Stun Needle
