attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reinforced Needle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

data.flavorText: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

data.name: Shelmet
data.flavorText: When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell. This reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast, however, because they can still get into the shell.

data.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Freeze Dry
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains.

data.name: Breloom

attacks.name: Dynamic Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.flavorText: It scatters poisonous spores and throws powerful punches while its foe is hampered by inhaled spores.

data.name: Piplup

attacks.name: Water Spash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 10 more damage.

data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Cleffa

abilities.name: Sweet Sleeping Face
abilities.text: As long as Cleffa is Asleep, prevent all damage done to Cleffa by attacks.

attacks.name: Eeeeeeek
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 6 cards. Cleffa is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

attacks.name: Aqua Trance
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Super Hypnoblast
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

data.name: Scraggy
data.flavorText: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling it skin up to its neck.

attacks.name: Gouge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Accelgor

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon and heal all damage from it.

data.flavorText: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.

abilities.name: Temper Tantrum
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may discard as many cards as you like from your hand. If you do, put that many damage counters on Banette. This power can't be used if Banette is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Darkness Switch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Banette, and then switch all damage counters on Banette with those on the Defending Pokémon. (If an effect of this attack is prevented, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Loneliness
attacks.text: You may show your hand to your opponent. If you do and if you don't have any Pokémon in your hand, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Unlucky Wind
abilities.text: As long as Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her turn, treat it as tails.

attacks.name: Conform
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Seal Off
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies during your opponent's next turn.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

data.name: Floatzel

abilities.name: Water Acceleration
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Floatzel. This power can't be used if Floatzel is affected by a Special Condition.

data.flavorText: With its flotation sac inflated, it can carry people on its back. It deflates the sac before it dives.

data.name: Politoed

abilities.name: Frog Song
abilities.text: Whenever Politoed's attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), if there are more than 3 Poliwags, Poliwhirls, Poliwraths, and/or Politoeds in play (including your opponent's), that attack does 40 more damage (no matter how many heads you get). This power stops working while Politoed is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Doubleslap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

data.flavorText: Whenever three or more of these get together, they sing in a loud voice that sounds like bellowing.

data.name: Petilil

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.flavorText: The leaves on its head grow right back even if they fall out. These bitter leaves refresh those who eat them.
